newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged on low demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged on low demand.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates remained steady on Wednesday on low demand from mill owners, but are likely to fall in the coming weeks owing to surplus stocks with ginners from the 1996/97 (July-June) crop, dealers said.

"The prices will fall as ginners still have large quantities of unsold cotton from the 1996/97 crop and the arrival of the new crop is due in June," dealer Khushi Ram said. "There is low demand from mill owners as they are short of cash."
The Pakistan Cotton Ginners Association said the 1996/97 cotton output had reached a provisional 8.761 million 375-lb bales by May 1, down from 9.938 million in the year-ago period.
